title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16 ยง 561.16 - Contingent assets and liabilities
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16 ยง 561.16 - Contingent assets and liabilities

State Regulations

Contingent assets represent a possible source of value to
the utility contingent upon the fulfillment of conditions regarded as
uncertain. Contingent liabilities include items which may under certain
conditions become obligations of the utility but which are neither direct nor
assumed liabilities at the date of the balance sheet. The utility shall be
prepared to give a complete statement of contingent assets and liabilities
(including cumulative dividends on preference stock) in its annual report and
at such other time as may be requested by the commission. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16
ยง
561.16

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
